alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 14 at 9:07PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley affecting Humboldt County zone. .Warm temperatures may melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Martin Creek...including Paradise Valley...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Major flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 08:25 PM PDT Friday the stage was 3.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning at 1015 AM PDT.
